channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 'We want justice,' say the family of 10 civilians killed in a US airstrike that officials now say was 'a mistake'
item.description: Emal Ahmadi knew his brother Zamarai wasn't the ISIS-K facilitator that American officials portrayed him to be in the days after his death. Now, at last, the whole world knows that too.

item.title: Australia had 'deep and grave' concerns about French submarines' capabilities, PM says
Human remains found in Wyoming are 'consistent' with description of Gabby Petito, FBI says
item.description: As local and federal agencies search for Gabby Petito in a Rocky Mountain national park, law enforcement are also working to locate her fiancé Brian Laundrie, who his family says has not been seen since Tuesday.

item.title: In Canada and Germany, the climate crisis is finally on the ballot. But can it win?
item.description: It was just last week that Canada's British Columbia finally ended its state of emergency, more than two months after wildfires tore through parts of the province and reduced an entire village and its surroundings to ash.

item.title: CNN correspondent: Recalling envoys a move 'reserved for adversaries, not for allies'
item.description: CNN's Melissa Bell reports.

item.title: 2 pilots injured after a military aircraft crashes in a residential neighborhood in Texas
item.description: A military training aircraft crashed in Lake Worth, Texas, on Sunday, according to the Fort Worth Fire Department.

item.title: Volcano erupts on La Palma in Spain's Canary Islands
item.description: The Cumbre Vieja volcano in La Palma, one of Spain's Canary Islands, erupted Sunday, after several earthquakes were felt over the weekend.

item.title: 3 people were shot at a Pennsylvania baby shower after an argument over gifts, police say
item.description: Three people were shot and wounded at a baby shower in Pennsylvania Saturday evening after an argument over gifts, Lower Burrell Police Chief John Marhefka said in a press briefing.

item.title: Angry and afraid, Afghanistan's LGBTQ community say they're being hunted down
item.description: Growing up as a teenager in Afghanistan, Rabia Balkhi felt lucky.

item.title: This boy is concerned about the vaccine. Dr. Gupta explains why it's important
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta took on one of the hardest interviews, taking questions from children. He met with elementary students in Atlanta to answer their questions about Covid-19 and how to stay safe. They spoke outside in masks in compliance with school policy.

item.title: Hundreds of anti-lockdown protesters clash with police in Australia
'They didn't betray us yet,' says stranded Afghan ally with enduring hope of US rescue
item.description: Wakil's eyes fill with tears. He has no idea whether he and his family will get out of Afghanistan, and fears that if they don't the Taliban will hunt him down and kill him.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Chris Rock says he has Covid. 'Trust me you don't want this,' comedian tweets
item.description: Comedian and actor Chris Rock revealed Sunday that he has tested positive for Covid-19, and he is using the opportunity to urge others to get vaccinated against the virus.

item.title: French slackliner crosses the Seine from the Eiffel Tower in breathtaking stunt
item.description: Crowds lining the banks of the Seine and visiting the Eiffel Tower in Paris this weekend were treated to an unusual sight -- a slackliner charting an unusual path across the skies above their heads.

item.title: The UN General Assembly is about to start. Here's what to watch for
item.description: Coronavirus be damned, the world's diplomats are back.

item.title: Historic all-civilian space flight splashes down off Florida coast
item.description: • Rare photos show the early years of NASA's space shuttle era

item.title: Jimmy Greaves, England World Cup winner and Tottenham legend, dies aged 81
item.description: Jimmy Greaves, a World Cup winner with England in 1966 and one of the most prolific goalscorers in English football history, has died at the age of 81, his former club Tottenham said.

item.title: College professor recognizes 17th century masterpiece hanging in a nearby church
item.description: A simple act led to an art history professor discovering a 17th century masterpiece that was thought to have been missing.

item.title: After 169 hospitals, a dad finally got the Covid-19 care he needed -- and changed dozens of skeptics' minds
item.description: Every breath Robby Walker takes is one that almost didn't happen.

item.title: Covid-19 origins: Why the search for the source is vital
item.description: No clear culprit.

item.title: Aerial video shows shocking reality at the Texas border
item.description: More than 9,500 migrants who have arrived at the US border in the past 48 hours are living under a bridge, and thousands more migrants are expected in the coming days. CNN's Rosa Flores reports.

item.title: Red carpet photos from the Emmy Awards
Tropical Storm Rose forms as the 17th Atlantic storm of 2021, continuing the busy tropical season
item.description: This year's busy tropical season continues as more activity ramps up in the Atlantic.

item.title: The words Trump couldn't bring himself to say
item.description: On November 7, 1962, Richard Nixon met with reporters to concede that he had lost his bid for governor of California -- and to grumble about the way the press covered his campaign. It was two years since he had lost his race for president against John F. Kennedy, and few thought Nixon would ever run for office again.

item.title: Richard Branson hates cruise ships, so why'd he build one?
item.description: When you step into the Scarlet Lady cruise ship, you know immediately you're on Richard Branson's ship.

item.title: The US military needs to do more than apologize for its deadly 'mistake' in Kabul
item.description: On August 29, a US drone strike killed 10 members of one family in Kabul. That same day, the Pentagon announced that the operation successfully targeted a suicide bomber affiliated with ISIS-K, who had allegedly filled a car with explosives as part of a suspected plan to attack the Hamid Karzai International Airport, where US troops raced to complete their evacuation operation a day before their deadline.

item.title: Breyer defends state of Supreme Court in interview with CNN's Fareed Zakaria
item.description: As the Supreme Court finds itself in an unwelcome political spotlight at the start of a new term, Justice Stephen Breyer defended the institution Sunday in an interview on CNN's "Fareed Zakaria GPS," insisting that the court is driven not by political considerations, but by judicial philosophy.

item.title: 'Go get that mouse!': CNN interview gets purr-fect interruption
item.description: CNN's Bianca Nobilo received a surprise visit from a feline friend while interviewing Speaker of the UK House of Commons, Sir Lindsay Hoyle.

item.title: Texas doctor says he violated the state's strict new abortion law
item.description: A Texas doctor is publicly revealing that he violated a state law that bans abortions after six weeks and says he is inviting legal challenges under the controversial law, which has so far withstood efforts by pro-abortion rights supporters to block it.

item.title: Officer catches a 1-month-old baby dropped from 2nd floor balcony, authorities say
item.description: A police officer caught a 1-month-old baby dropped from a second-floor balcony in Jersey City, New Jersey, on Saturday morning, according to authorities.

item.title: Russia goes to the polls amid crackdown on political dissent
item.description: Millions of Russians are expected to head to the polls over a three-day period starting Friday in elections taking place against the backdrop of an unprecedented assault on democracy over the past year.

item.title: One of Asia's most prestigious universities is on the frontline of a battle for democracy
item.description: Students and lecturers at Hong Kong's most prestigious university returned from summer break this month to a very different institution.

item.title: New Netflix series 'Grendel' first to use Muslim Arab man as lead in a comic book adaptation
item.description: Abubakr Ali was 10 years old when two hijacked airplanes crashed into the World Trade Center in New York City on September 11, 2001.

item.title: Adele all but confirms Rich Paul is her boyfriend with new Instagram post
item.description: Rumors have been swirling for months about the status of Adele's relationship status, but now she is making it official on her Instagram account.

item.title: Cuba vaccinates children as young as 2 in strategy to reopen schools, economy
item.description: The Cuban children sat in a Havana hospital watching a brightly painted clown perform his earsplitting act. They were not there for the performance, but were waiting their turn to receive one of Cuba's homegrown Covid vaccines.

item.title: Here's why hurricane hunters fly their planes in weird patterns into storms
item.description: The second half of hurricane season is here and there have already been 15 named storms to keep hurricane hunters busy. But have you ever noticed hurricane hunters' flight patterns shown by meteorologists on TV look like random, odd shapes?

item.title: The world's tallest nation is getting shorter
item.description: The Netherlands has long been the world's tallest nation -- but its people are getting shorter, according to Dutch researchers.

item.title: Here's when you can download iOS 15
item.description: Apple is releasing iOS 15, its eagerly anticipated operating system for iPhone and iPads, on September 20.

item.title: How to watch the 2021 Emmy Awards
item.description: The Emmy Awards are Sunday night, celebrating the best TV of the year.

item.title: Two of Queen Elizabeth's sons are facing growing pressure
Chile, Fiji and South Africa are ready for travelers to come back
item.description: There have been mixed fortunes for the world's island communities this week, as some have restricted entry due to Covid surges while others are making plans for reopening.

item.title: Walmart tests self-driving delivery cars
item.description: Walmart is testing a driverless car, in partnership with Ford and Argo AI, that delivers your order straight to your door. HLN's Elizabeth Prann reports.

item.title: Boston's 'Skinny House,' known as the narrowest home in the city, sold for more than $1.2 million
item.description: It's tiny, but mighty.

item.title: Why Anderson Cooper is finally embracing his roots
item.description: Anderson Cooper says that as a kid, in particular, he avoided mentioning his kinship to the Vanderbilts, one of America's richest families during the Gilded Age. Today, that association still makes him "cringe," he says, but "after my mom's death and when my son Wyatt was born, I began to wonder what I would actually tell him one day about that branch of his family tree."

item.title: Puma launches an Animal Crossing clothing collection
item.description: German sports retailer Puma is collaborating with Nintendo's Animal Crossing: New Horizons, bringing a few elements of the popular world-building game to real life.

item.title: Notre Dame cathedral in Paris will reopen in 2024, five years after disastrous fire
item.description: The Notre Dame cathedral is on track to reopen to the public in 2024 as the cathedral has now been entirely secured, two years after the disastrous fire that destroyed large parts of the 850-year-old building.

item.title: After a sudden U-turn on a multibillion defense deal that caused anger in Paris, Australia's PM said that the country's 'national interest comes first'
item.description: • Why new defense pact is fueling anger

item.title: It's not only the French who are furious
item.description: The US and UK will be sharing technology and expertise with Australia to help it build nuclear-powered submarines as part of a newly-announced defense pact between the three countries. The move has sparked fury in France, which has lost a long-standing agreement to supply Australia with diesel-powered subs.

item.title: France's fury at new Pacific security pact
item.description: Former French ambassador to the United States Gérard Araud and Fareed on Australia's cancellation of a big maritime security deal with France.
